field.comment: The subtype that represents the CDM data that this system has.
field.name: typeId

field.comment: The fields that are initially high quality enough to be merged into an existing CDM instance.
field.name: initialMasterTypeId

field.comment: If the system is only master of a subset of those fields, you can set a sub-subtype here
field.name: masterTypeId

field.comment: If the system can only update a certain subset of those fields, you can set a sub-subtype here. For example we might not be able to update a "created" timestamp, or a boolean might be a meta calculation, not an actually persisted value. This could otherwise falsely be flagged as being out of date. All fields in the slave document must match verbatim, other fields might not have a correct representation. For example an "enabled" boolean for soft delete might be exposed through the definition to clarity but not be representible in the target system.
field.name: slaveTypeId

field.comment: A service to pull multiple entities. By default we assume you will be pulling all entities. If you have an optimized last modified pull, set the optimized boolean to true.
field.name: batchPullId

field.comment: The limit you want to use in pull all. This defaults to 100.
field.name: batchPullLimit

field.comment: The priority of this subscription in all subscriptions for the CDM
field.name: priority

field.comment: The subscription might only apply to a portion of the cdm instances, you can set a filter here
field.name: filter

field.comment: You can limit how often we pull data. This will be compared to the last pull date.
field.name: pullInterval

field.comment: A normal subscription will be pulled (either batch or per entity) for a synchronization. You can skip this however if the subscription is intended to use triggers for every update.
field.name: triggerOnly

field.comment: By default a subscription will both update existing entities and create new ones. If you set this to true, we will not create new ones
field.name: updateOnly
